New Records: Freddie Freeman became the first player to hit a walk-off grand slam in World Series history.
Freddie Freeman is the first Dodger to homer in consecutive World Series games since Justin Turner in 2020.
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in Game 1.
The game went into 10 innings before deciding a winner in Game 1.
The Yankees had the bases loaded with one out in the ninth inning of Game 2.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers' offense had an MLB-best 121 wRC+ in the postseason.
The Dodgers had five extra-base hits in each of the first two games, a rare occurrence in World Series history.
Others: Starting pitchers Jack Flaherty and Yoshinobu Yamamoto performed well, keeping the games close.
